summary: Run Away to the Circus - flannelflowers - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Run Away to the Circus - flannelflowers - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Sansan Greatest Showman AU. Rated M.

Sansa Stark is engaged to Joffrey Baratheon but everything is not as happy as the New York high society would believe. Sansa and Arya take a visit to see their cousin Jon Snow at his new investment, the circus. The act that catches Sansa’s eye is a large, intimidating, strong man called The Hound.

summary: About Sansa's endgame, do you think it's possible for her to be the Queen/Lady of Winterfell? Her being a Regent for Rickon...
question: About Sansa's endgame, do you think it's possible for her to be the Queen/Lady of Winterfell? Her being a Regent for Rickon would be great, but her entire arc being political makes me more inclined for her to be the sole ruler, instead of Bran or Rickon. GRRM highlighted the fact that there's never been a female ruler of Winterfell multiple times, and if the series doesn't end with a woman as Winterfell's leader (not a consort or a Regent) it would be almost disappointing
answer: Possible? Certainly. But I’m personally not keen on sacrificing Bran (to the astral plane) and Rickon to have Sansa become Lady of Winterfell. But I’m very attached to the idea that Sansa might be the Stark that holds Winterfell during the thick of the War for the Dawn, and I do think her story arc strongly supports her ruling in some capacity. Personally, I’d love nothing more than for the surviving Starklings to work as a unit post-war. Give me Bran the Rebuilder using his magical knowledge to rebuild Winterfell and the North. Give me Sansa taking on the day-to-day ruling and her ancestors’ historical duty to care and provide for her people. Give me Arya being the North’s protector and warrior. Rebuild, provide and protect. I’m in love with the idea of them being a ruling unit that embodies the very role Winterfell was built for, each with their own area of expertise to reflect their current training montages.

by flannelflowers

Sansa Stark is engaged to Joffrey Baratheon but everything is not as happy as the New York high society would believe. Sansa and Arya take a visit to see their cousin Jon Snow at his new investment, the circus. The act that catches Sansa’s eye is a large, intimidating, strong man called The Hound.

Or Sansan Greatest Showman AU

tags: And both were troubled by these deaths
summary: I just realised that both of Sansa's "bastard"-husbands killed their predecessors to titles they had a not-so-solid claim...
body:
I just realised that both of Sansa’s “bastard”-husbands killed their predecessors to titles they had a not-so-solid claim to.

And then I think about writing having a prominent “rule of three” - especially in agot.

summary: Hi, I am very new in tumblir and I signed in trully because I am desperatelly in love with the jonsa theory! I want to ask how...
question: Hi, I am very new in tumblir and I signed in trully because I am desperatelly in love with the jonsa theory! I want to ask how do you think danny will react when she sees jamie who kiled her father and tried to kill her after all, even though she must be waiting for his arrival, based on the gathering at dragon pit. Sorry for my eglish by the way, I am not a native speaker.
answer:
Fun ask! There was nothing at all wrong with how you asked there. I’m continually impressed with people who know far more about language than I do!

As to Dany reacting to Jaime…it will be awfully tricky for her. She’ll want to kill Jaime..I’ve little doubt. Even without the complicated history of him killing her father, Jaime also tried to kill Dany herself so it’s already personal.

The question would be whether she feels enough pressure from Tyrion in how she deals with Jaime, whether the Starks join her in this (versus taking a more “yesterday’s wars don’t matter” viewpoint of forgiveness) to insulate him a little bit, and also whether Jaime heads straight into Winterfell and actually has a face to face interaction with her. 

Jaime Lannister has a fairly decorated history of snark directed at people who could easily have him killed. I’m not sure why Dany would be any different. 

I think a couple subtle indications that the Starks won’t be as harsh with Jaime as might be expected are: 

A) That Tyrion expected Jon to hate Cersei even more than Dany does, but Jon was mature enough not to make a personal grudge against Cersei a central issue during S7 (which is one of the reasons why the lack of continuity between Dany and Jon should have stuck out more to people given the fact that Jon really does have a lot more reason to hate Cersei than Dany does but Jon didn’t allow that to cloud his mission); and 

B) Sansa ever-so-subtly called Jaime “Ser Jaime” with Brienne before sending Brienne to King’s Landing for the summit in her stead. Sansa also acknowledged to Brienne that Jaime had treated her honorably and would in all likelihood protect her while she was in King’s Landing when Sansa thought Brienne believed going to King’s Landing was dangerous to Brienne. 

So Jon already subverted what Tyrion expected when he assumed Jon would make an easy ally because he would HAVE to agree to go to war with Cersei and Sansa used very interesting language in calling Jaime “Ser” instead of the Kingslayer. By also saying that Jaime had treated Brienne “honorably” she again subtly subverted this idea of Starks eternally at war with Lannisters because honor is not something that you’ll catch many people associating with Jaime anywhere in Westeros, much less north of the Neck.

When Jon said “yesterday’s wars don’t matter” I think he really meant it. 

I expect Dany to be more than a little dismayed if Jaime isn’t tried for her father’s murder, and even more confusingly for her, if the Starks refuse to try Jaime for pushing Bran from the tower. The Stark tradition of turning foes into friends and the Targaryen tradition of turning friends into foes into foes forever and ever could play out in such a way to present the two factions with clear differences and as foils in yet another aspect.

summary: **Sansa Stark Mobile Headers** I have used this header for most of the time my blog has been active, but it’s time to trade it...
caption:
**Sansa Stark Mobile Headers**

I have used this header for most of the time my blog has been active, but it’s time to trade it in now that I’m multifandom!

I am releasing this header in hopes that others can get some use out of it because it literally took me days to make. There are additional colors under the cut.

Please feel free to download from this post - likes and reblogs are appreciated!

blog.name: an-oranophobic-maniac
blog.title: It is better to be ridiculous than boring

summary: After watching this pic I an slightly convinced that sansa would be delivering her icy courtesy not only to Dany but also to...
body:
About Sansa…

After watching this pic I an slightly convinced that sansa would be delivering her icy courtesy not only to Dany but also to Jon. From her POV now, it atleast would seem like that he never listens or validates Sansa’s opinion. If they are indeed seated to the left side of Jon in the house high table, this could be a deliberate move from Sansa to place Bran inbetween them as a means to distance herself from him, since as a lady of winterfell I think her seat would have got to be closer to the centre than Bran’s.

I first thought, she would be burning with anger when Jon finally comes to winterfell and throw things at him but I think now all he would see is what it is like to be subjected to Sansa’s famous “wall-of-ice” politeness.

Until the parentage-reveal bomb ofcourse

blog.description: Ella. 18. GoT sideblog. Primary is @followinglilies. Tracking #tuserel.

tags: its just very wintery where i am and its making me think about thinhs
so enjoy some fluffy winter scenes happier than anything HBO will give us
body:
Some Winterfell Dany Headcanons

  • Dany is in awe of the weather in Winterfell. She’s seen snow north of the wall but that was different. There the wind blew harshly and the cold cut through the flesh and straight to the bone. Snow flew around making it hard to see or breathe or do much of anything. Winterfell was nothing like that when she arrived. It was bitterly cold but there was a softness to the weather. The snow fell in delicate flurries and rested soft and pillowy on the ground. That softness was reflected in Dany, the way her eyes glistened at the white landscape and the hint of a smile came to her lips.
  • Dany isn’t used to the snow or ice. Her balance is off completely and she slips and stumbles in her first few steps. She has too much confidence in her movement and falls flat on her ass in a mound of snow. A horde of people swarmed around her with concern but she waved them all away. The only thing hurt was her pride. She was more careful from then on, falling on her face probably wouldn’t be a very regal first impression. Every once and a while she would begin to slip and would subtly grab onto Jon’s arm with an iron grip.
  • Dany doesn’t deal very well with the cold. She prefers the warmth, always has. She’s always close to a fire and sleeps with a pile of blankets the size of a mountain. She notices Missandei is also having a hard time with the cold. Dany notices her friend shivering and shaking. Despite her own coldness, Dany takes off her scarf and offers it to Missandei. Missandei refuses, of course, but Dany insists and wraps the scarf around her.
  • One day, on a walk through the grounds, a snowball comes flying through the air towards Dany. Everyone around her bristles protectively. Dany stands in shock as the cold snow melts and trickles down the neck of her coat. Who would dare throw snow at Daenerys Storborn of the House Targaryen, First of Her Name, Rightful Heir to the Iron Throne, Mother of Dragons, Breaker of chains, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea? Arya Stark would. She stood across the courtyard smirking playfully. Everyone around looked on in slight terror of how Dany would retaliate. Well, everyone except Jon. Jon pressed a hand to his mouth and tried to hide his chuckles. Jon’s laughter was enough to lighten Dany up. She knelt down and grabbed a fistful of snow. She tossed it in Arya’s direction but Arya swiftly dodged out of the way. The snowball kept going and crashed straight against Lady Sansa. Sansa initially looked enraged and appalled. But the feelings quickly have way and she couldn’t help but smile. Sansa has grown up playing in the cold north. Sansa returned the fire with a perfectly aimed snowball that crashed right against Dany’s face. Jon couldn’t hide his laughter anymore and let out a loud chuckle. This drew all attention to him and both Arya and Dany has the same idea. Two snowballs went flying towards him, one hitting his precious hair. Everyone who passed by looked on in awe as some of the most important people in all of the seven kingdoms had a full on snowball fight.

summary: the rules of the game - chapter 5, checkmate | Nox on Patreon
title: the rules of the game - chapter 5, checkmate | Nox on Patreon
excerpt: Join Nox on Patreon to get access to this post and more benefits.
description:
“You’re right. I would do anything for my children. But that’s my children, not yours. So if I were you, and I wanted my daughter back in my arms, I would kneel.”

Daenerys takes another few steps forward. “That throne you desire so much, it means nothing. That crown, it means nothing. The Seven Kingdoms are Five and they do not answer to me as queen, they answer to the Council of Wardens. The power that was in that chair has no power anymore. If you want it so bad, take it. The thing is hideous to look at anyway.”

“Something one Queen does, can be undone by another,” Cersei growls.

Read the fifth and final chapter of the rules of the game a week before the public for only $1 a month!

summary: i’m so curious about the process sansa goes through before she starts knitting. does she first draw it on a piece of paper or...
body: i’m so curious about the process sansa goes through before she starts knitting. does she first draw it on a piece of paper or does she use her imagination? does she start with the rest of the outfit before making the embroidered pieces? can she draw/knit humans or is it just animals?
